sentences.en: a democracy that produced Socrates and allowed him to philosophize freely until his seventieth year.
sentences.cn: 毕竟是民主哺育了苏格拉底,并允许他自由地进行哲思,直到他七十岁为止。

sentences.en: He even produced the White House concert in celebration of jazz musician Duke Ellington's seventieth birthday in nineteen sixty-nine.
sentences.cn: 1969年，他甚至在白宫主办了一次音乐会，纪念爵士音乐家杜克.埃林顿七十岁诞辰。

sentences.en: They changed and said it would come when the skin reached the seventieth floor.
sentences.cn: 他们只好改口说,要等大楼外墙建到70楼,才会出现干扰.

sentences.en: They congratulated him on his seventieth birthday.
sentences.cn: 他们祝贺他的七十寿辰.

sentences.en: Tyler was past his seventieth birthday when his 15th child was born.
sentences.cn: 泰勒总统七十岁生日时，他第十五个孩子降生了。

words.tran_cn: 第十七的，第十七个的；十七分之一的
七十的；七十个的；七十岁的
七十；七十个；七十岁；七十年代

trans.tran_cn: 第七十的，七十分之一的
